channel.title: Alex Tighe's Demo Clips
channel.description:
Hi, I make audio and I code. I built this podcast feed from scratch to showcase some podcast clips I've made and am proud of.
The audio on this feed is normalised to -18 LUFS.
channel.itunes:author: Alex Tighe

item.title: 7am: When Hindenburg crashed into Adani
item.description: The 7am podcast is Australia's equivalent of NYT's The Daily – each episode is a deeply reported and produced narrative that brings the news to life. I was the Supervising Producer of 7am and the sole producer of this episode, which tells the story of the Adani Group: its rise, its entanglement in Indian politics, and the fallout when Hindenburg Research named the group "The Largest Con In Corporate History". I had heaps of fun making this episode: over a day-and-a-half I directed the interview, sourced all the tape myself, scored the entire episode, and edited the final assembly.

item.title: Left Right Out calls Emily
item.description: Left Right Out was the #1 election podcast that we made for Spotify - I was the co-creator and executive producer, and Justine and Elfy were the wonderful hosts. For our final episode, I arranged for some of our superfans to be available to take calls from Justine and Elfy to reflect on the show. This clip is from that episode, when we called Emily: the call was heavily edited, although I hope you can't tell, and it's the best way I have of conveying the impact and popularity of a show we made from scratch.

item.title: Can you have a casino without the crime?
item.description: From the 7am podcast (Australia's The Daily), this is a short sequence from an episode about allegations of illegal junkets operating within Sydney's Star Casino. Ruby Jones is the host and Rick Morton is the reporter, and this clip is one of those magical audio moments where two people are clearly enjoying themselves on mic. I did a lot of massaging of this segment to ensure that our Ocean's Eleven-style soundtrack lined up perfectly with Rick's words.

item.title: 2WCRFM: My Radio Debut, Age 13
item.description: I began making radio at age 13 and here is the sweet proof: an 'interview' that my friend, Nathan Chapman, did we me during one of our pre-recorded segments. We also played Shakira, Fergie, Maroon 5, and an Aussie alt-rock band called Faker. We thought we were so cool; we weren't, but at least we were cute.
